text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Province of L'Aquila | native_name = | native_name_lang = it | settlement_type = Province | image_skyline = L%27Aquila_Piazza_del_Duomo_2007_by-RaBoe.jpg | image_alt = Piazza del Duomo at L'Aquila. | image_caption = Piazza del Duomo at L'Aquila. | image_flag = Flag of the Province of L'Aquila.svg | flag_alt = | image_shield = Provincia dell'Aquila-Stemma.svg | shield_alt = | image_map = L'Aquila in Italy.svg | map_alt = Map with the province of L'Aquila in Italy | map_caption = Map with the province of L'Aquila, in red, in Italy | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = Abruzzo | established_title = | established_date = | seat_type = Capital | seat = L'Aquila | parts_type = Comuni | parts_style = para | p1 = 108 | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = President | leader_name = Angelo Caruso | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 5047.55 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 301910 | population_as_of = January 2017 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 67100, 67010, 67012-67015, 67017, 67019-67041, 67043-67064, 67066-67069 | area_code_type = Telephone prefix | area_code = 0862, 0863, 0864 | iso_code = IT-AQ | registration_plate = AQ | blank_name_sec1 = ISTAT | blank_info_sec1 = 066 | website = Official website | footnotes = }} The province of L'Aquila () is a province in the Abruzzo region of Southern Italy. Its capital is the city of L'Aquila. It is the largest province of the region but the one with fewest people living in it; it is a landlocked province, that is, surrounded by other provinces by all sides. ==Geography== L'Aquila is the largest province in the Abruzzo region. It is almost half of the area of the region: it has area of . The province is bordered on the north by Tuscany, to the northeast by the province of Teramo, to the east by the Pescara and Province of Chieti provinces, to the south and southeast with the Molise region (province of Isernia), and to the west and southwest by the Lazio region (province of Frosinone, Rome and province of Rieti). The main river in the province is the Aterno-Pescara river, known here as Aterno; it starts in the Monti della Laga and flows through the province. L'Aquila is the province of the Abruzzo region with more mountains; there are three mountain ranges that go from the northwest to the southeast, and that are parallels to the coastline: Monti della Gaga, Gran Sasso and Majella massif. The highest mountain in the province is Monte Amaro,() in the Majella massif, Apennines; it is high and is the highest mountain of three provinces: Chieti, L'Aquila and Pescara of the Abruzzo. ==Population== There are 301,910 persons living in the province (January 2017), for a population density of inhabitants/km². This population has been more or less stable for a long time. The largest comune is L'Aquila, with and the smallest is Villa Sant'Angelo, with . The comune with fewest people living in it is Carapelle Calvisio with 88 inhabitants. ===Main comuni=== The following table shows the 10 comuni with more inhabitants with their population, and their area and altitude. No. Comune Population (2017) Area (km²) Density Altitude (m) 1 L'Aquila 473.91 714 2 Avezzano 104.09 695 3 Sulmona 57.93 405 4 Celano 82.80 800 5 Pratola Peligna 28.67 342 6 Tagliacozzo 87.46 740 7 Castel di Sangro 84.44 793 8 Trasacco 51.44 685 9 Luco dei Marsi 44.87 680 10 Carsoli 95.80 616 ==Gallery== File:L'Aquila, Basilica di San Bernardino 2007 by- RaBoe-1.jpg|San Bernardino basilica in L'Aquila.
